info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 23 at 2:53PM MDT until October 23 at 4:45PM MDT by NWS Grand Junction CO
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southwest Colorado, including the following county, La Plata.
* WHEN...Until 445 PM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Some low-water crossings may become impassable.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 253 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 0.6 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Dry Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Eastern La Plata County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Arroyos, streams, and rivers can become raging currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON
